modules.description: Manages application state and user interactions through a cycle of updates and views, using a model-view-update pattern. It operates on a state type defined by the developer, along with messages that trigger state changes. It is used to create interactive command-line interfaces, such as progress indicators or menu-driven tools.

The module offers functions for constructing and adjusting terminal styles through immutable updates, focusing on color, text formatting, and layout properties. It manipulates data types like color values, boolean flags, and style records, with operations such as reversing text, adding strikethroughs, or adjusting width. These tools are tailored for customizing terminal output formatting in applications requiring precise control over visual presentation.
